name: RollerCoaster Tycoon® 2: Triple Thrill Pack
description: This compilation includes the entire RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 series, with the original game as well as the Time Twister and Wacky Worlds expansions.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or Windows Vista Processor: 1.8 GHz Processor Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 3D graphics card compatible with DirectX 7 DirectX: Version 7.0 Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Ahh Steam I see what you did here. Your trying to take all my free time away from me! Dont worry you can have it. Ahh my childhood. Well over 1000+ hours on this baby and still kicking strong. When I found out they had it for steam and it worked on my new desktop instead of those funky colors, I was stoked! Now I am continuing my saves that are on my backup drives from years ago! Its a blast still to this day.   Heck I first got this game in elementary school at a Scholastic book sale. It was THE LAST DISK avalible. Man, to thinkthat if there was one more class before us, I may have never found out about this gem. Not a fan of the new 3D versions, wish they would go back to the old way and just update everything again. RCT2....forever and ever.   10/10 would go back to elementary and get disk again.
Still works with windows 10 :D

This game. Oh man, this game. I got my first disk copy out of a box of Cheerios, and I played the absolute  hell  out of it. I easily poured about three thousand hours into that disk, and I loved every second of it. By the end of it I had well over 200 save files, some of which were actual serious parks and the rest simple sandbox parks where I had no objective and just ♥♥♥♥ed around with the patrons. Then, the unthinkable happened. A virus destroyed the family computer, and when we got a new one, I found that the disk refused to install on it. Fast forward ten or so years later. I was browsing steam out of boredom when I stumbled across Roller Coaster Tycoon 2 again, bundled together with its two expansion packs for a humble price of $11 CAN. Childhood memories came rushing back in a blur and I nearly fell off my bed in sheer excitement. A week later I got my hands on a copy of the game (Thank you, Jordy!!) and I was soon on my way to a serious nostalgia trip.   The Pros!

It's pretty hard not to do a joke review about this game with all of the top-tier memes it gives you.  However, this is a game I hold dearly. It has a place in my heart no other game can fill, and it will always be the first computer game I ever had that gave me something to show off to friends with.  You see, if you got this game from a cereal box (like most of us did), you are part of the best generation to experience PC gaming.  Or, who knows. Maybe you played the crap out of text-based adventures back in the day and just happened to love sugary cereal at the tender age of adulthood.  It truly was a good time to get into the idea of gaming on your computer. Not because legendary, classic titles came in cereal boxes, but because everyone of the 'common genres' of game weren't set in stone yet and plenty of new companies were making PC games that were always probing an aspect of the video game that hasn't been looked into before. Nowadays the market of new games can be separated into 'niche indie titles', 'AAA games with PC ports' and the rare 'well-rounded good game'. Back then... you had the Tycoon series.  Ladies and gentlemen, the Tycoon series of games was probably what saved me from adolescent boredom and actually gave me something fun to do on Windows 98.  Bored after school? Boot up 'Extreme Heights' and build another coaster that manages to do 10 loops in a row.  You could basically build whatever park you wanted and force dumb, oblivious NPCs to eat up whatever crap you make. The system was intricate. It was always giving you feedback for how reasonable your setup is, as well as fine-tuning over even the most menial tasks.  The slow nature of the game gave the players a lot of choice and challenge. Do you spend all of your money at once for something that can either make or break the park, or build a bunch of safe, small rides that will only gradually build me money?  It feels a little weird writing this review because of the fact that I never really stopped with RollerCoaster Tycoon games. It's a game I will always respect and my one hope is that it is never lost and forgotten.  The nostalgia value in this game is equivalent to Sock 'Em Boppers and Lincoln Logs.
My childhood for $10
Highly recommended to anyone.Works perfectly with my Windows 8 laptop.

Where I grew up, in rural eastern Ukraine, in the early 2000's, there was no internet, no smartphones, no kfc and NO FREE PORN! There was however intel pentium...and Roller Coaster Tycoon!!. I remember spending hours, meticulously building my park from scratch, earning milions on big rides and food, attracting 6k+ guests into my park...and then torturing them, by cutting off the escape routes, flooding paths and charging $15 for toilet. And it was magical, pure joy. Even now, with the graphics definitely looking tired, it will bring you hours of very simple fun, build a ride and see how much you can charge before guests say its enough. Or starve them, then build one burger bar, put a very steep price and watch money flooding in. Or even better, build a coaster that will eventually crash, then comfort all the mourners with free black balloons...and free rides on the coaster that just has crashed! Yes, this game was always my favourite, a safe haven where I could unleash all my sadistic fantasies! And after all these years, nothing has changed, I still love to see the message 'Robert D. has just drowned'.

Magnus P., This is the name of a sad man... A sad man that just wished to see his family after waiting in line for 'Walk alot to get here and die' which was a fine atraction built apon the park named 'Why do you want to die'. After waiting for so long the ride shut down and he was forced to walk through the exit, at this point he did'nt realise what had happened... He quickley realised the path he was on led to no where and he was doomed to walk this path until the day he dies. He continues walking the path as he spouts depressed phrases such as, 'I want to go home.' and 'I cant find the exit to the park.' and even once 'I have the strangest feeling someone is watching me.' Soon after Mr.P died of hunger and thirst never to see his family again... Some say if you listen closley you can still hear Magnus P. to this day...
I bought this game becuase RollerCoaster World struck such terror in me, that I needed to return to the orginals.
Trapped people in a pit and forced them to pay $20 for hamburger or face starvation. 11/10
Literally my child hood in a game. So worth $10

Roller Coaster Tycoon 2 is one of the most amazing simulation games to date. The potential for creativity is unlimited in this game, where the world - or in this case, your theme park - is literally your playground. Create to your hearts content, challenge yourself with tough and fun missions, and build breathtaking rollercoasters. It's all up to you!  Even though Roller Coaster Tycoon 3 is out and is also a very well made game, there's something about the premise and the nostalgia of RCT2 that makes it superior to its sequel. If you have a spare $10 in your pocket and are willing to let your creativity run wild, buy this game. You will not regret it.  (P.S - The best part about this game is that you can drown 2000 guests at once)
Steam says I've done 40 hours but I've really done over 1,000 hour as I used to play this as a kid. So download it right now

A classic staple of the Roller Coaster Tycoon franchise, the 2nd installment is a great game for any theme park fan! The game's selections over rides can be great, though after a while its selection will get a bit boring. There isn't enough flat rides to go, Then again thats why we always have mods! It's design gives us a time of when video games were simpler. It can be fun to build roller coasters... or drown your guests. This game is fun for anyone, and I would recommend this to anyone who is a fan of Atari, Chris Sawyer, Theme Parks, Roller Coasters, or anything in that mix!
Highly Recommended! Spent my childhood playing this for well over 1000 hours or more and it still entertains me till this day!

This is my childhood in a nutshell  -Builds Shop  -Civilian Complains that the side walks are to dirty  -Traps Civilian in a Single walk way  -Makes a food store next to walkway  -civilian throws up He walks in it  -I laugh 10/10 Would trap civilians in walkways again
Still one of my favourite games to this day

This game stands the test of time. After all this years it has lost nothing of its charm and quality, and with the addition of OpenRCT2 it even gained some. To this day there is no replacement for RCT2.   I fully recommend this game to everyone who enjoys management or sandbox building games and fans of entertainment parks or rollercoasters.

Well worth the money,graphics ain't the best but that shouldn't stop you buying this game,i jumped on this when i see it listed and haven't regretted it one bit.  10/10  One of my favourite games of all time!

I love this game and played it non-stop when it came out. Almost 15 years later this version works perfectly, so that's pretty cool. It still is one o fthe best Tycoons out there, let alone theme park tycoons.

PROS: -It's Rollercoaster Tycoon -It's pretty much the same as the first game except with more stuff, meaning they didn't ruin everything. The ATM and boatload of scenery is especially a nice touch -I've read it's considered the 'best' Rollercoaster Tycoon, meaning there's likely a healthy supply of fanmade content for the game  CONS: -20 second long crowd noise loop still irritating as hell. 'ROLLER COASTER' 'BUT WHYYYYY' 'EHAHAHAHAHA. BWAAAHH. OOOHOOOOHOOOHOOO.' It was cute for nostalgic reasons for about 2 minutes before I wished they made a longer, more varied sound for crowded areas -It's pretty much the same as the first game except with more stuff, meaning they didn't seem to add that much -The scenarios suck my toes. Almost all of the ones I've tried so far make you wonder if they even put any thought into making them. Half the time the existing rides don't even have names. The scenery looks good (or, at least, it probably did back in the day, so I'm trying to judge it on that) but most of the time it just gets in the way. Sometimes guests get lost on the  pre-existing paths . You rarely allowed to charge per ride so you're stuck entirely relying on vendors and admission fees. Give me Forest Frontiers or Dynamite Dunes over Alcatraz and Rio anyday -Maybe I haven't figured it out yet but it seems like there's no way to access the Steam community inside the game, which makes playing while you're chatting with someone a pain in the neck.  Overall, despite my criticisms, it's cheap and fun and it's in no way worse than the original (aside from the scenarios). If you're asking yourself if you want to pick it up, you probably do.
good game brings memorys from years ago have had no problems with it and its just really good.
Remains the best of the series. Love it!
Really great! Brings back memories of playing this game! I`m glad that this game is on steam. WORTH BUYING!!!!

This game is a good chunk of my childhood. When my CD for this game didn't work anymore, I felt like I would never play it again. Low and behold, it's on Steam. Hallelujah. I bought right after I found out.  Steam users will be able to see how awesome the RCT fanchise used to be, and how much better the 1st and 2nd games (the 3rd game wasn't too bad) are compared the more recent installments of the series (Rollercoaster tycoon 3D was bad, but 4 Mobile is worse).

Most nostalgic moments you'll ever get. OpenRCT2 made it even more fun, and guess what? Now you have multiplayer mod! Time to get serious.  Anyway, this is the tycoon game which you operate your own amusement park. There're many things you can do such as building custom rollercoaster, unique attraction,   rocket proving ground with your guests in it , stuffs like that. Meanwhile, you have to be cautious about economy if you don't wanna go bankrupt.  Well, that's all I can describe this game. You can do anything you want. So, is it worth a try? Absolutely yes.    Now go make some concentration camp

Still one of the best games I have ever played! Never played RCT3 and considering not playing RCTW in case it ruins my view of the franchise.   Also I seem to be in the minority of people who don't kill park guests, poor little fellas.  It's almost criminal to have not played this game. 10/10

Triple the thrill, triple the fun! This game is one of my best childhood games ever! I'm really glad Steam added it here! Build your own theme park! Build exciting roller coasters! Get a lot of guests in your park and have a full blast experience with your park! This game really brings back memories for me. Personally recommend this game to anyone who loves roller coasters and theme parks as much as I do!

Well over a decade on, and there is not another single game I have ever played for likely even half of the time as I have RCT2. And that includes some MMOs that have a year+ logged in time. I nearly cried with happiness when I finally realized this was on Steam. I bought RCT2 and the two expansions when they each launched, and the triple thrill pack - I used the TTP disc so much It was *taped together*. I spent hours getting it to line up when it started to crack. Thats a sign of how amazing this game is.  If you find building and sim games fun, you can't go wrong here. The customization and themes are awesome and can give hours of fun.  You can also download all of the maps from the original RCT for this, a large chunk of which were released officially, and hundreds if not thousands of other maps custom designed. There are some amazing parks out there.  Fun tip, there is a .dll mod out there to run it in windowed mode. For some reason its not default in RCT2, but it was an option in the original..
A classic just like the first, but with a few more features and options and variety. Awesome game!

I cannot stop playing this game! I had this game when i was little and its just as fun! This game still holds up. The graphics are quite dated but gameplay is top notch. A must play ;) I'd give Rollercoaster Tycoon 2 a 9.5/10
Found some little kid who hated my park I picked him up with my claw tool I introduced him to the lake He can't swim No one must ever find the body

Now this is nostalgia!. I don't know how many hours i spent back in the early to mid 00's playing this but it was plenty. Never played the scenarios much, for me it was all about the sandbox. Just build away to your hearts content. I know a few people have had problems getting the game running (unsurprising given it's age), but maybe i got lucky as it installed and ran without issues on my Win 7 64-bit rig. You won't get it running at big resolutions, at least not without patches but it still looks OK at full screen.  Recommended, to bring back those great gaming memories!

This review is coming from someone who purchased rct3 before purchasing rct2. Those of you that own rct3 and are considering purchasing rct2, this review should help. So I will list pros and cons about rct2 compared to rct3  PRO'S:  - The peeps (AI) form sizeable queue lines for your rides, making you feel like your ride is popular - Lag does not exist in this game - Created by Chris Sawyer - Altogether, it feels like a better game (in my opinion, of course) - Go Karts are overpowered :) - Pre-built Six Flags amusement parks  - Awesome Pre-built rides (If you're lazy...) - Unique scenarios (i.e. Great Wall of China scenario where you have unlimited money but have to keep park rating above 700 at all times.)  CON'S: - No 3D view like in RCT3 - You can't ride your rollercoasters - Park staff are equally as useless as they are in RCT3 - No nighttime phase (some would consider that a pro)  CONCLUSION: Overall, there is not a significant difference between RCT 2 and 3. Atari didn't change much for RCT3 other than 3D view. If you thoroughly enjoyed RCT3, you will thoroughly enjoy this game.
4 words:  You can drown people.  Also, you can make roller coasters.  10/10.
This is a great game. Both this one and the first one are great tycoon games. If u do not like tycoon games then this is not the game for you. Go play call of duty or something.

Very fun, even after nearly 13 years of being out. I like this more than RCT3 because of the retro feel, and it's just a very enjoyable game. Still recommended if you haven't got it yet, especially now that you get the game and both DLCs for only $10.
The most important part of this review is on the last paragraph, and also keep in mind that Steam hours don't count in OpenRCT2, even when put as a non-steam game.     Pros

Over a year later I bought it again on a brand new computer with extremely good requirements and high hopes. Unfortunately it frequently crashes at random, and when you go to save the game it instantly crashes and though I was never able to even save a game, out of hope, when I clicked to attempt to load a save game, the game instantly crashes as well and you have to completely start over. Definitely disappointed and hope these issues get resolved some day.

As a child I only played RCT I without expansions and mastered all the tracks on it. It was hard but rewarding when you made a park that actually earns money with guests being happy and not puking everywhere. RCTII is my childhood on steroids and even thoug I'm no longer a child I still like to play this game on rainy days, listen people scream from joy and build rides, scenery and paths.

I have since upgraded to a very nice gaming computer and this game can not run once without crashing within the first twenty minutes of playing it but it still is a super great game....
YES...ITS AMAZING!
Totally worth it. If it's on sale, it's even more worth it. If you enjoyed RCT2 as a kid, the released version on here brings back so many memories it's worth every dollar.

must have on every pc / windows tablet i own low spec, runs smooth on whatever pc you have (because of it's age) Easy isometric graphic engine, easier to handle compared to the 3d rct3 stress free gameplay with pauze button, doesn't require all your attention, all the time,  if you get bored of the game, it's just because you temporally lack imagination let's you play as you want; financial/physical realistic rides or artistic moneypits using cheatcodes

RCT2 is strongly recommended for any simulation/management fans. This 2002 game shows that a good design and an eye for quality goes a long way. Hastily made 3D graphics may break what could've been a good game (i.e. RCT3) and will not help if the underlying mechanic is not fun, nor will any amount of advertising, DLCs or graphical bells and whistles.  I've been playing this game on and off since it came out. I bought it twice, once as a hard copy and again on steam. This game provides enourmous value per $$$. Time to relax and have some fun.
After all these years, this game is as addictive as ever. Be prepared to spend hours building your theme parks. 8/10

RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 is a very fun game when you get into it. You might have a bit of a slow start with it (your attack and speed will be halved for five whole turns!), but soon, you'll be building parks that rival the best real world parks. Manage your finances wisely, though. If you go crazy, you might find yourself in debt. There's a great amount of content for this game, and though it probably won't last forever, it's definitely capable of taking a few hundred hours out of your slowly decreasing lifetime. At least those few hundred hours will be spent having fun.  Please, try not to kill people. You can do that in this game, but please don't. It will be detrimental for your park's reputation, and also, it's killing people. I have yet to understand why so many players decide to kill their guests.  Windows 10 users, you may experience a problem with the game. It tends to crash very frequently on Windows 10, but there's a way around it. If you go into the steam files for RCT2 and troubleshoot the program's compatabiliy, you should be able to set it to run in Windows 7 mode. If you do that, it should work fine.
Always trap first guest to dare come to my park. 10/10 a fun game!
Not compatible with windows 10. Crash if you hit alt + tab. Bought the rct3 instead.
Pro Tip: Get the RCT2 User Created Expansion set for a bunch more senarios and rides.

A good classic game, if you want to chill and like to build stuff. ^^

All-time classic. If you like coasters and/or theme parks, go for it! Totally worth it, considering the low price.   Great developer, too..

Only got 7 hours on Steam, but alot more from before Steam. Whenever I need to just relax and have fun, I go to this game. I've replayed it countless times, and will reply it countless more. No tycoon game has ever come close to replace this.
After more than a decade I still play and can reccomend this game

Even though the graphics are really old and the resolution is really low, it is still playable and fun even today. It isn't obvious for a game to remain fun after 14 years, especially with all of the flashy new games that come out every day, and with the new technology, but this game is one of the rare games that still manage to do it.

Excellent classic park-management sim. You can incorporate the scenarios from the original game to here in order to vastly increase the amount of gameplay available. Seek out the player-made online multiplayer mod to have fun with friends!
Ahhhh sweet sweet building and management. Flawless game that is still relevant, 14 years later.
This PC game has never let me down! Ever since I had it on 98!

Ever since I was 10, this has been the game that got me hooked on pc games. An instant classic, it will bring you right back to your saturday morning memories. I recommend this game to anyone who wants to relive this classic, but will actually know what they're doing at their age.
great game! haven't had any problems running it on win 7. on a notalgia trip and it's awesome

A great port to steam! I've played countless hours of this game in my childhood, this is my favorite 'Tycoon' game there is, and one of my favorite games of all time. Full of nostalgia and fun! Absolutely Recommend it if you've never played a Roller Coaster Tycoon game before.

Very good game, It's graphics are slightly dated but it doesn't make a difference. It has a steep learning curve so i recommend going on the rct wiki, to see how to be good at the game. It also comes with the 2 expansion packs, so you can play more levels with more rides and scenery.   Perfect game for playing when you're bored or being creative.

I still give this a thumbs up, but I think that this should be fixed...

When someone wants to leave the park, just stick them on that path. If they complain too much, let them drown.

Used to own this game disc. So good to own it again on Steam! Love building awesome roller coasters!

Played this game as a kid so nostalgia may be getting the best of me. Either way this game is a phenomenal park building game with a wide range of features and options along with a brilliant isometric tile set. The only real complaints I have is the wonkey guest path finding and rowing boats getting stuck.  I enjoyed this game more than RCT3, but this may just be personal taste as RCT3 Is also a good game.  As a final note, definitely buy this over Roller Coaster tycoon world or the other recent cash-grabs, it won't disappoint you.
I played this game growing up in middle school. I loved it to death. It's nice to have it again. Many hours will be spent on this.

Was a great game when I played it as a kid and it still is now.
Just as good as I remember. Classic game !

This game is a total classic and a blast to play if you're an enthusiast for Roller Coasters or Tycoon games. It's engaging enough to try to keep an amusement running smoothly, but even more fun if you put in some imagination and build something truly unique. One park I made was one that was a looooong line of carousels that exit into other carousels. No one ever made it to the end.  Just be warned that this game has some compatibility issues with modern PC's. I'd recommend getting OpenRCT2, as it fixes those issues and provides more options for screen resolution and mod support.
Roller Coaster Tycoon 2  All the best of Roller Coaster Tycoon 1 & 2 with none of the extra BS of Roller Coaster Tycoon 3. ...enough said...

An absolute classic for all gamers interested in Roller Coaster Management games. This game not only provides players with the ability to create a vast range of coasters, flat and dark rides, but also allows your imagination to shine. A huge range of decoration and scenery items, allows you to create a park of your dreams. This game combines the ability to create wonderful turns and twists of roller coasters, whilst having to manage the park from a staff point of view.   Pricing of rides and merchandise, to taking out a loan to fund your new development area. This game has it all.   If you manage to complete the huge varied range of levels, all of which focus on different themes and objectives, you can create your own scenarios for others to play, or, design rides to import into your park.  I would highly recommend this game to anyone who has the most remote interest in theme parks!
Works on Win10.

I still love the music of this marvelous game.  I think I spent most of my youth for this game and yet I can still play this over and over.  Its pretty sad that the franchise is going down due ot the massive failure with RCT:World, I can confidently say that the concept of park management survived with Planet Coaster (Frontier is a true successor of RCT franchise tbh)

This game plays surprisingly well on modern systems, unlike most old games. Even modern potatoes are able to play this, what is a huge plus for me. Even the visuals are fine, it aged pretty well.  It is exactly how I remember it, I would say this artifact is worth a shot.
The best way to kill virtual people since 2002.

I have been playing this game off and on for about 11 years now. Even though this game got a lot of flak at launch for being much the same as the original game, I believe this title added a lot of extra elements that made the challenge mode experience more difficult and fun. It's a shame they made deathcoasters harder to make, but the added challenges and level editor had always drawn me to play this game instead of the original for so long. Buy this game on sale if you're not willing to put a lot of time into it though, there is no fast forward button and it requires you to idle for extended periods of time. Overall, a great game!
